intro: Tricuspis novae-boracensis, commonly known as the New Zealand tricuspis, is a unique flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
